intro: Souroubea peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian souroubea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Souroubea peruviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
